title: Ticket #2273: provide defaults for should_transfer_files & when_to_transfer_output
description:
should_transfer_files and when_to_transfer_output have no default set by condor_submit.

Simple installations of Condor, such as yum install condor + configure CONDOR_HOST, will result in every job submission having to specify their own values.

A far superior out-of-the-box experience is to default IF_NEEDED and ON_EXIT, respectively.

This allows the underlying complexity of shared filesystems and FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN configuration to be completely ignored until it is needed.

NOTES:

  1. condor_submit on Windows currently specifies defaults of YES and ON_EXIT. This default should be changed to IF_NEEDED and ON_EXIT to be consistent.
  2. TransferFiles is still an option in the code, but has been deprecated since 6.5 (~03), and does not appear in any documentation.
remarks:
2011-Jun-27 13:57:15 by matt:
Testing on a single system (personal condor) -

Add STARTD.FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN = not-$(FULL_HOSTNAME) to configuration.

Submit echo 'cmd=/bin/sleep\nargs=2d\nqueue' | condor_submit.

Failure will be a job that never runs, condor_q -bet - 

$ condor_q -bet


-- Submitter: eeyore.local : <127.0.0.1:53848> : eeyore.local
	Reason for last match failure: no match found

WARNING:  Be advised:
   No resources matched request's constraints

The Requirements expression for your job is:

( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) &&
( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( ( TARGET.Memory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) &&
( ( RequestMemory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) &&
( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain )

    Condition                         Machines Matched    Suggestion
    ---------                         ----------------    ----------
1   ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == "eeyore.local" )0                   REMOVE
2   ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" )       4
3   ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" )       4
4   ( TARGET.Disk >= 30 )             4
5   ( ( 1024 * TARGET.Memory ) >= 30 )4
6   ( ( 1024 * ceiling(ifThenElse(JobVMMemory isnt undefined,JobVMMemory,2.929687500000000E-02)) ) >= 30 )
                                      4

Success is a running job.

2011-Jun-27 13:59:44 by matt:
Verification with just condor_q - 

$ condor_q -format "%s " GlobalJobId -format "%s " ShouldTransferFiles -format "%s" WhenToTransferOutput -format "\n" None
eeyore.local#68.0 NO
eeyore.local#69.0 IF_NEEDED ON_EXIT

Job 68.0 shows the old behavior. Job 69.0 shows the new behavior.

2011-Jun-28 15:13:34 by matt:
In the end I gave up and re-organized the logic. The included test shows that condor_submit was never properly tested.

2011-Aug-29 11:58:44 by tannenba:
This ticket essentially set the default transfer to be IF_NEEDED. Unfortunately, there are two problems identified in the testing of v7.7.0:
  1. this default change is happening for both local and scheduler universe jobs
  2. IF_NEEDED has long-standing bugs (see #1811)

To react to the two above problems, commit [27009] sets the default in condor_submit back to how they were. Once the above two problems are fixed (e.g. once #1811 is resolved), this commit should be reverted. I will note this in ticket #1811.

2011-Aug-29 12:40:01 by matt:
Instead of reopening this ticket, let's take one of the others and resolved based on it. I suggest taking #2282 with a plan to have should_transfer_files=NO as default for Scheduler and Local universe jobs. The alternative fix (arguably more complete) in the FileTransferObject is likely to be substantially more difficult. Lease #1811 for the more complex fix to FileTransferObject.
